description:
When i want to launch a instance i got the message:  Stdout: '/usr/bin/nova-rootwrap: Incorrect configuration file: ovs-vsctl\n' .

I'm using OpenStack Folsom with Quantum and OpenVswitch plugin. (I'm using the packages in Folsom Trunk Testing)
I've a network node that's running:
- quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent
- quantum-l3-agent
- quantum-dhcp-agent

Cloud controller runs:
- rabbitmq
- nova-api
- nova-scheduler
- nova-keystone
- quantum-server

Compute node runs
- nova-compute-qemu
- quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent

Config in /etc/sudoers.d/nova_sudoers
on Cloud controller and Compute node
nova ALL = (ALL) NOPASSWD: /usr/bin/nova-rootwrap

This is the error that I get in the log files of the nova-compute:

nova.compute.manager [req-0c1c9acb-91f7-4eda-b951-1b9b21b2abd4 956ac3cb6ca84d719ff3a35c3551aa11 69f1efdb67234772bd6d1580a0b4a28d] [instance: a21ce43d-a102-4cb2-b2fb-7b68f
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 743, in _spawn
block_device_info)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/exception.py", line 117, in wrapped
temp_level, payload)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
self.gen.next()
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/exception.py", line 92, in wrapped
return f(*args, **kw)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 1056, in spawn
block_device_info=block_device_info)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 1820, in to_xml
rescue, block_device_info)
 File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 1778, in get_guest_config
cfg = self.vif_driver.plug(instance, (network, mapping))
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py", line 162, in plug
instance['uuid'])
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py", line 136, in create_ovs_vif_port
 run_as_root=True)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 198, in execute
cmd=' '.join(cmd))
ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
Command: sudo nova-rootwrap ovs-vsctl -- --may-exist add-port br-int tap0c1a77c0-fa -- set Interface tap0c1a77c0-fa external-ids:iface-id=0c1a77c0-fa67-4103-96a2-0b659750b2e8 external-ids:iface-status=actve external-ids:attached-mac=fa:16:3e:95:64:fc external-ids:vm-uuid=a21ce43d-a102-4cb2-b2fb-7b68f8ddb993
Exit code: 97
Stdout: '/usr/bin/nova-rootwrap: Incorrect configuration file: ovs-vsctl\n'
Stderr: ''

Let me know if you need further information.

Best regards.

Eduard
title: Instance fail to launch due to Stdout: '/usr/bin/nova-rootwrap: Incorrect configuration file: ovs-vsctl\n'

comments.content:
When i want to launch a instance i got the message:  Stdout: '/usr/bin/nova-rootwrap: Incorrect configuration file: ovs-vsctl\n' .

I'm using OpenStack Folsom with Quantum and OpenVswitch plugin. (I'm using the packages in Folsom Trunk Testing)

Config in /etc/sudoers.d/nova_sudoers

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ecj-eleonora

comments.content:
Looks like your rootwrap configuration was not updated to Folsom style.
Could you post the settings of the "root_helper" and "rootwrap_config" options ?
You should have something like "rootwrap_config = /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf" and no root_helper.

See http://wiki.openstack.org/Packager/Rootwrap
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
Thierry,

Thnx for the fast response 
I had actually in my nova.conf file 
root_helper=sudo nova-rootwrap
by changing it to 
rootwrap_config=/etc/nova/rootwrap.conf

The error went away now a got a new error 
if ret == -1: raise libvirtError ('virDomainCreateWithFlags() failed', dom=self)
 libvirtError: internal error Process exited while reading console log output: char device redirected to /dev/pts/3
qemu-system-x86_64: -netdev tap,ifname=tap165b61d8-87,script=,id=hostnet0: could not open /dev/net/tun: Operation not permitted 
qemu-system-x86_64: -netdev tap,ifname=tap165b61d8-87,script=,id=hostnet0: Device 'tap' could not be initialized

rootwrap_config
# Configuration for nova-rootwrap
# This file should be owned by (and only-writeable by) the root user

[DEFAULT]
# List of directories to load filter definitions from (separated by ',').
# These directories MUST all be only writeable by root !
filters_path=/etc/nova/rootwrap.d,/usr/share/nova/rootwrap

root_helper config 
cannot find it where can I find it?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ecj-eleonora

comments.content:
nova.conf

[DEFAULT] 
# LOGS/STATE 
verbose=True 
logdir=/var/log/nova
state_path=/var/lib/nova
lock_path=/var/lock/nova 
# AUTHENTICATION
auth_strategy=keystone 
# SCHEDULER
compute_scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.filter_scheduler.FilterScheduler

# DATABASE
sql_connection=mysql://nova:PASS@MYSQL-IP/nova 


# COMPUTE  
libvirt_type=qemu 
compute_driver=libvirt.LibvirtDriver
instance_name_template=instance-%08x
api_paste_config=/etc/nova/api-paste.ini 
allow_resize_to_same_host=True 


# RABBITMQ 
rabbit_host=IP-SERVER

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ecj-eleonora

comments.content:
I've fixed that issue to, by adding in /etc/libvirt/qemu.conf
cgroup_device_acl = [
    "/dev/null", "/dev/full", "/dev/zero",
    "/dev/random", "/dev/urandom",
    "/dev/ptmx", "/dev/kvm", "/dev/kqemu",
    "/dev/rtc", "/dev/hpet","/dev/net/tun",
]

THnx Thierry now I can luanch a instance
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ecj-eleonora

I've fixed that issue to, by adding in /etc/libvirt/qemu.conf
cgroup_device_acl = [
    "/dev/null", "/dev/full", "/dev/zero",
    "/dev/random", "/dev/urandom",
    "/dev/ptmx", "/dev/kvm", "/dev/kqemu",
    "/dev/rtc", "/dev/hpet","/dev/net/tun",
]

THnx Thierry now I can luanch a instance

Dear Thierry,

First off all i want to thank you for your support.
Now I got a stupid question, how can I change the bug into solved?

greets,

Eduard
